name: Sarah M. Preum
content:
Sarah M. Preum | Department of Computer Science Skip to main content Sarah M. Preum Assistant Professor Appointments Assistant Professor of Computer Science Adjunct Faculty, Department of Biomedical Data Science, Geisel School of Medicine Faculty Affiliate, Center for Technology and Behavioral Health (CTBH) Technical Associate Director, Dartmouth Center for Precision Health and Artificial Intelligence Area of Expertise Natural Language Processing, Human-AI Interaction, Multimodal AI, Social Computing, Computational Health Download CV Download CV Biography My research lies at the intersection of human-centered natural language processing (NLP), human–AI interaction, social computing, and computational health. I design socio-technical AI systems that reduce communication burdens, support uncertainty-aware decision-making, and enhance outcomes in high-stakes, communication-intensive domains, such as healthcare. My work spans a range of settings, from primary and critical care to emergency medical services and online health communities, across both the U.S. and the Global South. I focus on building AI systems that work collaboratively with people, adapt to context and user needs, and promote equitable and trustworthy technology. My research has been recognized with a Google Research Scholar Award, Rising Stars in EECS selection, multiple best paper nominations, and funding from the NIH, NSF, Google, CTSA, and other institutional grants. I also serve as an Associate Editor for ACM Health. View More Education B.Sc. Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology M.Sc.
